Package com.example.recipeoop_1.controller

Class RecipeController

java.lang.Object
com.example.recipeoop_1.controller.RecipeController
@RestController @RequestMapping("/api/recipes") public class RecipeController extends Object
Handles HTTP requests related to recipe management.

Provides RESTful endpoints for creating, reading, updating, deleting (CRUD), and searching recipes. It also includes an endpoint to list all available recipe categories. Authentication is required for all endpoints, and specific roles (USER, ADMIN) are enforced per endpoint as detailed in method documentation. The base path for these endpoints is /api/recipes.

Since:
2025-05-14

    • RecipeController

      @Autowired public RecipeController(RecipeService recipeService, CategoryService categoryService)

  • Method Details

    • getAllCategories

      @GetMapping("/categories") @PreAuthorize("hasAnyRole(\'USER\', \'ADMIN\')") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<List<String>> getAllCategories()
      Retrieves a list of all available recipe categories.

      Requires USER or ADMIN role.

      HTTP Method: GET Path: /api/recipes/categories

      Response:

      • 200 OK: Successfully retrieved the list of categories. Returns a list of strings. 
        
 ["Dessert", "Main Course", "Appetizer"]
      • 401 Unauthorized: If the user is not authenticated.
      • 403 Forbidden: If the authenticated user does not have the required role.
      Returns:
      A ResponseEntity containing a list of category names and HTTP status 200 (OK).

    • createRecipe

      @PostMapping @PreAuthorize("hasAnyRole(\'USER\', \'ADMIN\')") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<Recipe> createRecipe(@RequestBody Recipe recipe)
      Creates a new recipe in the database.

      This endpoint expects a JSON representation of the recipe in the request body. The username of the authenticated user making the request will be associated as the creator of the recipe. Requires USER or ADMIN role.

      HTTP Method: POST Path: /api/recipes

      Request Body (Example JSON): 

      
 {
 "title": "Spaghetti Carbonara",
 "ingredients": ["Spaghetti", "Eggs", "Pancetta", "Pecorino Romano", "Black Pepper"],
 "instructions": "Cook spaghetti. Fry pancetta. Mix eggs and cheese. Combine all.",
 "cookingTime": 20,
 "category": "Main Course"
 }
      (See Recipe for details on the request/response structure)

      Response:

      • 201 CREATED: If the recipe is created successfully. Returns the created Recipe object in the response body.
      • 400 BAD REQUEST: If the input data is invalid (e.g., missing required fields, validation errors).
      • 401 UNAUTHORIZED: If the user is not authenticated.
      • 403 FORBIDDEN: If the authenticated user does not have the required role.
      Parameters:
      recipe - The Recipe object to be created, populated from the request body. Must not be null. Title, ingredients, instructions, and cooking time are typically required.
      Returns:
      A ResponseEntity containing the created Recipe and HTTP status 201 (Created), or an appropriate error status if creation fails.
      See Also:
      • RecipeService.createRecipe(Recipe, String)

    • getAllRecipes

      @GetMapping @PreAuthorize("hasAnyRole(\'USER\', \'ADMIN\')") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<List<Recipe>> getAllRecipes()
      Retrieves a list of all recipes from all categories.

      Requires USER or ADMIN role.

      HTTP Method: GET Path: /api/recipes

      Response:

      • 200 OK: Successfully retrieved all recipes. Returns a list of Recipe objects. 
        
 [
 { "id": "1", "title": "Recipe A", ... },
 { "id": "2", "title": "Recipe B", ... }
 ]
      • 401 Unauthorized: If the user is not authenticated.
      • 403 Forbidden: If the authenticated user does not have the required role.
      Returns:
      A ResponseEntity containing a list of all Recipe objects and HTTP status 200 (OK).
      See Also:
      • RecipeService.getAllRecipes()

    • getRecipeById

      @GetMapping("/{id}") @PreAuthorize("hasAnyRole(\'USER\', \'ADMIN\')") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<Recipe> getRecipeById(@PathVariable String id)
      Retrieves a specific recipe by its ID.

      This method searches across all categories for the recipe with the given ID. Requires USER or ADMIN role.

      HTTP Method: GET Path: /api/recipes/{id}

      Path Parameters:

      • id (String): The unique identifier of the recipe to retrieve.

      Response:

      • 200 OK: If the recipe is found. Returns the Recipe object in the response body.
      • 404 NOT FOUND: If no recipe with the given ID exists across any category.
      • 401 UNAUTHORIZED: If the user is not authenticated.
      • 403 FORBIDDEN: If the authenticated user does not have the required role.
      Parameters:
      id - The ID of the recipe to retrieve. Must not be null or empty.
      Returns:
      A ResponseEntity containing the found Recipe and HTTP status 200 (OK), or HTTP status 404 (Not Found) if the recipe doesn't exist.
      See Also:
      • RecipeService.getRecipeById(String)

    • getRecipeByCategoryAndId

      @GetMapping("/category/{category}/id/{id}") @PreAuthorize("hasAnyRole(\'USER\', \'ADMIN\')") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<Recipe> getRecipeByCategoryAndId(@PathVariable String category, @PathVariable String id)
      Retrieves a specific recipe by its category and ID.

      Requires USER or ADMIN role.

      HTTP Method: GET Path: /api/recipes/category/{category}/id/{id}

      Path Parameters:

      • category (String): The category of the recipe.
      • id (String): The unique identifier of the recipe within that category.

      Response:

      • 200 OK: If the recipe is found. Returns the Recipe object.
      • 404 NOT FOUND: If no recipe with the given ID exists in the specified category.
      • 401 Unauthorized: If the user is not authenticated.
      • 403 Forbidden: If the authenticated user does not have the required role.
      Parameters:
      category - The category name of the recipe.
      id - The ID of the recipe to retrieve.
      Returns:
      A ResponseEntity containing the found Recipe and HTTP status 200 (OK), or HTTP status 404 (Not Found).
      See Also:
      • RecipeService.getRecipeById(String, String)

    • updateRecipe

      @PutMapping("/{id}") @PreAuthorize("hasAnyRole(\'USER\', \'ADMIN\')") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<Recipe> updateRecipe(@PathVariable String id, @RequestBody Recipe recipeDetails)
      Updates an existing recipe by its ID.

      The recipe details are provided in the request body. A user can update a recipe if they are an ADMIN or if they are the original creator of the recipe. If the category of the recipe is changed, the recipe might be moved to a different underlying storage/collection. Requires USER or ADMIN role.

      HTTP Method: PUT Path: /api/recipes/{id}

      Path Parameters:

      • id (String): The ID of the recipe to update.

      Request Body (Example JSON): 

      
 {
 "title": "Updated Spaghetti Carbonara",
 "ingredients": ["Spaghetti", "Eggs", "Guanciale", "Pecorino Romano", "Black Pepper"],
 "instructions": "Updated instructions...",
 "cookingTime": 25,
 "category": "Main Course"
 }

      Response:

      • 200 OK: If the recipe is updated successfully. Returns the updated Recipe object.
      • 400 BAD REQUEST: If the input data is invalid.
      • 401 UNAUTHORIZED: If the user is not authenticated.
      • 403 FORBIDDEN: If the authenticated user is not the creator and not an ADMIN.
      • 404 NOT FOUND: If no recipe with the given ID exists.
      Parameters:
      id - The ID of the recipe to be updated.
      recipeDetails - A Recipe object containing the new details for the recipe.
      Returns:
      A ResponseEntity containing the updated Recipe and HTTP status 200 (OK), or an appropriate error status.
      See Also:
      • RecipeService.updateRecipe(String, Recipe)
      • RecipeService.getRecipeById(String)

    • deleteRecipe

      @DeleteMapping("/{id}") @PreAuthorize("hasAnyRole(\'USER\', \'ADMIN\')") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<Void> deleteRecipe(@PathVariable String id)
      Deletes a specific recipe by its ID.

      This method searches across all categories for the recipe to delete. A user can delete a recipe if they are an ADMIN or if they are the original creator of the recipe. Requires USER or ADMIN role.

      HTTP Method: DELETE Path: /api/recipes/{id}

      Path Parameters:

      • id (String): The ID of the recipe to delete.

      Response:

      • 204 NO CONTENT: If the recipe is deleted successfully.
      • 401 UNAUTHORIZED: If the user is not authenticated.
      • 403 FORBIDDEN: If the authenticated user is not the creator and not an ADMIN.
      • 404 NOT FOUND: If no recipe with the given ID exists.
      Parameters:
      id - The ID of the recipe to be deleted.
      Returns:
      A ResponseEntity with HTTP status 204 (No Content) on successful deletion, or an appropriate error status.
      See Also:
      • RecipeService.deleteRecipe(String)
      • RecipeService.getRecipeById(String)

    • deleteRecipeByCategoryAndId

      @DeleteMapping("/category/{category}/id/{id}") @PreAuthorize("hasAnyRole(\'USER\', \'ADMIN\')") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<Void> deleteRecipeByCategoryAndId(@PathVariable String category, @PathVariable String id)
      Deletes a specific recipe by its category and ID.

      A user can delete a recipe if they are an ADMIN or if they are the original creator of the recipe. Requires USER or ADMIN role.

      HTTP Method: DELETE Path: /api/recipes/category/{category}/id/{id}

      Path Parameters:

      • category (String): The category of the recipe.
      • id (String): The ID of the recipe to delete from the specified category.

      Response:

      • 204 NO CONTENT: If the recipe is deleted successfully.
      • 401 UNAUTHORIZED: If the user is not authenticated.
      • 403 FORBIDDEN: If the authenticated user is not the creator and not an ADMIN.
      • 404 NOT FOUND: If no recipe with the given ID exists in the specified category.
      Parameters:
      category - The category of the recipe to delete.
      id - The ID of the recipe to delete.
      Returns:
      A ResponseEntity with HTTP status 204 (No Content) on successful deletion, or an appropriate error status.
      See Also:
      • RecipeService.deleteRecipe(String)
      • RecipeService.getRecipeById(String, String)

    • searchRecipesByTitle

      @GetMapping("/search/title/{title}") @PreAuthorize("hasAnyRole(\'USER\', \'ADMIN\')") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<List<Recipe>> searchRecipesByTitle(@PathVariable String title)
      Searches for recipes by a keyword in their title.

      The search is case-insensitive. Requires USER or ADMIN role.

      HTTP Method: GET Path: /api/recipes/search/title/{title}

      Path Parameters:

      • title (String): The keyword to search for in recipe titles.

      Response:

      • 200 OK: Returns a list of matching Recipe objects. The list may be empty if no matches are found.
      • 401 Unauthorized: If the user is not authenticated.
      • 403 Forbidden: If the authenticated user does not have the required role.
      Parameters:
      title - The title keyword to search for.
      Returns:
      A ResponseEntity containing a list of matching Recipe objects.
      See Also:
      • RecipeService.searchRecipesByTitle(String)

    • searchRecipesByCategory

      @GetMapping("/search/category/{category}") @PreAuthorize("hasAnyRole(\'USER\', \'ADMIN\')") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<List<Recipe>> searchRecipesByCategory(@PathVariable String category)
      Searches for recipes by their category name.

      The search is typically case-insensitive depending on the service implementation. Requires USER or ADMIN role.

      HTTP Method: GET Path: /api/recipes/search/category/{category}

      Path Parameters:

      • category (String): The category name to search for.

      Response:

      • 200 OK: Returns a list of Recipe objects belonging to the specified category. The list may be empty.
      • 401 Unauthorized: If the user is not authenticated.
      • 403 Forbidden: If the authenticated user does not have the required role.
      Parameters:
      category - The category name to search for.
      Returns:
      A ResponseEntity containing a list of matching Recipe objects.
      See Also:
      • RecipeService.searchRecipesByCategory(String)

    • searchRecipesByCookingTime

      @GetMapping("/search/cookingTime/{minutes}") @PreAuthorize("hasAnyRole(\'USER\', \'ADMIN\')") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<List<Recipe>> searchRecipesByCookingTime(@PathVariable Integer minutes)
      Searches for recipes with a cooking time less than or equal to the specified number of minutes.

      Requires USER or ADMIN role.

      HTTP Method: GET Path: /api/recipes/search/cookingTime/{minutes}

      Path Parameters:

      • minutes (Integer): The maximum cooking time in minutes.

      Response:

      • 200 OK: Returns a list of Recipe objects matching the criteria. The list may be empty.
      • 401 Unauthorized: If the user is not authenticated.
      • 403 Forbidden: If the authenticated user does not have the required role.
      Parameters:
      minutes - The maximum cooking time in minutes.
      Returns:
      A ResponseEntity containing a list of matching Recipe objects.
      See Also:
      • RecipeService.searchRecipesByCookingTime(Integer)

    • searchRecipesByIngredient

      @GetMapping("/search/ingredient/{ingredient}") @PreAuthorize("hasAnyRole(\'USER\', \'ADMIN\')") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<List<Recipe>> searchRecipesByIngredient(@PathVariable String ingredient)
      Searches for recipes containing a specific ingredient.

      The search is typically case-insensitive. Requires USER or ADMIN role.

      HTTP Method: GET Path: /api/recipes/search/ingredient/{ingredient}

      Path Parameters:

      • ingredient (String): The ingredient name or keyword to search for.

      Response:

      • 200 OK: Returns a list of Recipe objects containing the specified ingredient. The list may be empty.
      • 401 Unauthorized: If the user is not authenticated.
      • 403 Forbidden: If the authenticated user does not have the required role.
      Parameters:
      ingredient - The ingredient to search for.
      Returns:
      A ResponseEntity containing a list of matching Recipe objects.
      See Also:
      • RecipeService.searchRecipesByIngredient(String)

    • advancedSearch

      @GetMapping("/search/advanced") @PreAuthorize("hasAnyRole(\'USER\', \'ADMIN\')") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<List<Recipe>> advancedSearch(@RequestParam(required=false) String title, @RequestParam(required=false) String category, @RequestParam(required=false) Integer maxCookingTime, @RequestParam(required=false) String ingredient)
      Performs an advanced search for recipes based on multiple optional criteria.

      Criteria include title, category, maximum cooking time, and an ingredient. All parameters are optional. If a parameter is not provided, it's not included in the search filter. Requires USER or ADMIN role.

      HTTP Method: GET Path: /api/recipes/search/advanced

      Query Parameters (all optional):

      • title (String): Keyword to search in recipe titles.
      • category (String): Category name to filter by.
      • maxCookingTime (Integer): Maximum cooking time in minutes.
      • ingredient (String): Ingredient name or keyword to search for.
      Example: /api/recipes/search/advanced?title=chicken&category=Main Course&maxCookingTime=60

      Response:

      • 200 OK: Returns a list of Recipe objects matching all provided criteria. The list may be empty.
      • 401 Unauthorized: If the user is not authenticated.
      • 403 Forbidden: If the authenticated user does not have the required role.
      Parameters:
      title - Optional title keyword.
      category - Optional category name.
      maxCookingTime - Optional maximum cooking time in minutes.
      ingredient - Optional ingredient keyword.
      Returns:
      A ResponseEntity containing a list of matching Recipe objects.
      See Also:
      • RecipeService.advancedSearch(String, String, Integer, String)

    • getMyRecipes

      @GetMapping("/my-recipes") @PreAuthorize("hasAnyRole(\'USER\', \'ADMIN\')") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<List<Recipe>> getMyRecipes()
      Retrieves all recipes created by the currently authenticated user.

      Requires USER or ADMIN role.

      HTTP Method: GET Path: /api/recipes/my-recipes

      Response:

      • 200 OK: Returns a list of Recipe objects created by the user. The list may be empty.
      • 401 Unauthorized: If the user is not authenticated.
      • 403 Forbidden: If the authenticated user does not have the required role (though this is unlikely as both USER and ADMIN can access their own recipes).
      Returns:
      A ResponseEntity containing a list of the authenticated user's Recipe objects.
      See Also:
      • RecipeService.getRecipesByUser(String)

    • adminGetAllRecipes

      @GetMapping("/admin/all") @PreAuthorize("hasRole(\'ADMIN\')") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<List<Recipe>> adminGetAllRecipes()
      Retrieves all recipes in the system. This is an admin-only endpoint.

      This endpoint provides a comprehensive list of all recipes, potentially for administrative purposes. It differs from getAllRecipes() in its authorization requirement (ADMIN role only). Requires ADMIN role.

      HTTP Method: GET Path: /api/recipes/admin/all

      Response:

      • 200 OK: Successfully retrieved all recipes. Returns a list of Recipe objects.
      • 401 Unauthorized: If the user is not authenticated.
      • 403 Forbidden: If the authenticated user does not have the ADMIN role.
      Returns:
      A ResponseEntity containing a list of all Recipe objects in the system.
      See Also:
      • RecipeService.getAllRecipes()
